Description: Base and foot sherd of East Greek pottery plate; glaze fired red-brown; interior: band on wall with six-petal rosette on floor; exterior: traces of band at junction of base and ring foot; reserved on underside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
for parallels, see Bristol H2779.d and Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA59.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 33, pl. 21, no. 4a-b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1132)
